lines.text: Seriously, man. It's not that hard.
What isn't? You really think this all ties together?
Yeah, man! Like, the blood was easy. And there was a spell that handled hiding his pulse.
You don't think there's one more spell that could explain that hole?
That hole- it's unnaturally round and tidy, right? Not typical for a bullet hole.
I... guess it isn't. You have some idea why?
But... you know, <c=#FF0000>Portable Hole</c> makes temporary, nondestructive holes in stuff.
The spell lists a maximum radius... but it doesn't say anything about a <c=#FF00FF>minimum radius!</c>
If he cast it on <c=#FF00FF>himself,</c> he could create the appearance of a bullet hole, without actually getting hurt!
Not that your whole theory isn't entirely bonkers, but you've got one.
Bonkers? Pay attention, Leo! It fits the evidence!
Well, I'll be darned. You're not wrong.
And you know what? We can verify this one.
Let's just wrap up the rest of this, and then we'll see about closin' the case.
